item.title: UK 'to bring in 14-day quarantine for air passengers'
item.description: Airlines group says it has been told coronavirus quarantining will start from the end of May.

item.title: Government to urge us all to walk and cycle more
item.description: The transport secretary is expected to urge people to find more active ways to get to work.

item.title: VE Day: UK's streets not empty as filled with love, says Queen
item.description: Commemorating her father's VE Day address, she expresses pride in a UK the wartime generation would "admire".

item.title: Coronavirus in the UK: The first 100 days
item.description: How the government's policy has shifted from the first recorded case to the PM being treated in ICU.

item.title: Coronavirus: Tesla ordered to keep main US plant closed
item.description: It reportedly planned to re-open on Friday, but authorities say this could lead to more virus cases.

item.title: Coronavirus: Young men 'more likely to ignore lockdown'
item.description: Psychologists find they are more likely to meet friends than women.

item.title: Coronavirus: Public urged to watch out for fake products after 'surge' in reports
item.description: Councils have seen a "significant surge" in criminal activity, including the sale of bogus medical kit.

item.title: Coronavirus: Grace Millane's family donate care packages in her memory
item.description: The cousin of Grace Millane, who was murdered in New Zealand, says she would have been "so proud".

item.title: Coronavirus: Italy death toll tops 30,000, highest in EU
item.description: Italy has the third highest officially recorded coronavirus deaths, after the US and the UK.

item.title: US Vice-President Mike Pence's aide tests positive for coronavirus
item.description: The diagnosis comes one day after Trump's personal valet tested positive for the virus.

item.title: Trump laments ‘heart-breaking’ jogger killing
item.description: The 25-year-old was jogging in Georgia when he was shot dead, in a video the president described as disturbing.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Up to 2,000 UK seafarers stranded'
item.description: Mental health problems are growing and ship workers see "no end" to their ordeal, a union warns.

item.title: The Papers: 'Never give up', and all arrivals to be quarantined
item.description: Events to mark the 75th anniversary of Victory in Europe Day feature on most of Saturday's front pages.

item.title: Coronavirus: Bread and cake tips from a self-isolating baker
item.description: Ray normally runs his family bakery, Rinkoffs, but is currently staying at home with his wife.

item.title: Coronavirus: How they tried to curb Spanish flu pandemic in 1918
item.description: Face masks, fresh air and porridge - how people tried to curb a deadly flu pandemic in 1918.

item.title: Coronavirus: Huntington's care in lockdown
item.description: Danielle's mum Lisa is in the final stage of Huntington's and needs full-time care.

item.title: Norfolk Island morepork owls: Major breakthrough for rare species
item.description: Two fledglings may have safeguarded the future of the Norfolk Island morepork owl.

item.title: VE Day celebrations: The UK marks 75th anniversary
item.description: An RAF flypast and a national minute's silence are among the events marking the 75th anniversary.

item.title: Chvrches singer Lauren Mayberry on lockdown life in LA
item.description: Lauren Mayberry talks to the BBC's Unlocked podcast about lockdown in LA, social media and abusive relationships.

item.title: Coronavirus: Belarus WW2 parade defies pandemic and upstages Putin
item.description: Belarus goes ahead with a Victory Day parade, but in Russia coronavirus forced its cancellation.

item.title: Coronavirus: Six money-saving ideas for lockdown and beyond
item.description: Millions of people are facing pay cuts or less work, so how can you make your money go further?

item.title: Coronavirus: Compulsory vaccines in the UK and other rumours fact-checked
item.description: A round-up of what's been debunked includes rumours about mandatory coronavirus vaccines and patents.

item.title: Coronavirus: How is Suffolk's Little America coping in lockdown?
item.description: How are the communities that rely so heavily on the US airbases coping under lockdown?

item.title: Coronavirus: Challenge of reshaping UK cities for after lockdown
item.description: Replacing cars with bikes or walking will cut infections and address climate change, say campaigners.

item.title: Coronavirus: My lockdown hen party was virtually as good as the real thing
item.description: A bride-to-be’s friends and family organised the surprise event to replace the one they originally had planned.

item.title: Extra substitutes among temporary law changes when leagues resume
item.description: Teams will be allowed to use five substitutes when the season resumes after a Fifa proposal to help with fixture congestion was approved.

item.title: Greatest Fights: Sugar Ray Leonard, Thomas Hearns and 'The Showdown' of 1981
item.description: Sugar Ray Leonard and Tommy Hearns feature in fight one of a BBC Sounds look back at some of boxing's greatest fights.

item.title: Walker says he feels 'harassed' after lockdown breach reports
item.description: Manchester City and England defender Kyle Walker says he feels he is "being harassed" after it was reported he had broken social distancing rules again.

item.title: 'We were travelling overland from Scotland to Tokyo, now we're stuck in France' - how Olympics postponement has affected fans
item.description: We asked fans planning to attend Tokyo 2020 to get in touch with how the Olympics' postponement had affected them - here are their stories.

item.title: SPFL reconstruction talks break down after Premiership meeting
item.description: Scottish football's reconstruction talks end with insufficient support for any plan to reconfigure the leagues.

item.title: Chelsea in talks over England full-back Chilwell - gossip
item.description: Chelsea in talks over Chilwell, Blues and Manchester United interested in Chiesa, Red Devils ask about Salisu, plus more.

item.title: James Maddison, Michael Obafemi, Emerson & Aaron Connolly compete in Fifa invitational
item.description: James Maddison backs up his trash-talk while Irish international team-mates John Egan and Aaron Connolly compete against each other in the Premier League Fifa invitational.

item.title: Coronavirus: What has kept us going in lockdown?
item.description: Coronavirus has forced people in Britain to radically change the way they live their lives. Here are eight things that have helped us cope.

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: Will over-70s have to stay in lockdown?
item.description: Will the over-70s be treated differently to the rest of the population?

item.title: Coronavirus: Why might the R number be higher in Scotland?
item.description: The R-value is at the heart of decisions on easing the lockdown - so why might it be different north of the border?

item.title: Coronavirus: Why did the UK need 100,000 tests a day?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: The FBI said I was my parents' stolen baby - but I found the truth
item.description: Foundling Paul Fronczak was given to a family whose baby had been stolen - but was he really their son?
